Authors: Andi, Rio, Sugianti L., Meiliana, Budiharto W.
Title: Short message service application by using brain control system and Support Vector Machine (SVM) on Single Channel Electroencephalography (EEG)
Source title: Journal of Telecommunication, Electronic and Computer Engineering
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Andi, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rio, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sugianti, L., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meiliana, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiharto, W., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Most people who suffer from physical and sensory disabilities have limited activities. They need communication tools to facilitate communication activities with others. The purpose of this research is to create an application that translates thoughts to text which will be implemented in SMS feature by taking raw EEG from Emotiv EPOC, filtering, and applying machine learning algorithm, which is Support Vector Machine. There are two research steps: Analysis and implementation. In the analysis step, the EEG samples taken from respondents are used for analyzing the most dominant channel. Then, EEG signal extraction uses Emotiv EPOC SDK, filters EEG signal taken from the most dominant channel and applies SVM algorithm for data training. C# based UI application is used as interactive media, so user can see the extraction result. The result of this research is an application that translates human thoughts to SMS. © 2018 Universiti Teknikal Malaysia Melaka. All rights rerserved.
Author Keywords: Brain Computer Interface (BCI); EEG; Emotiv; Support Vector Machine
References: Vallabhaneni, A., Wang, T., He, B., Brain-computer interface (2005) Bioelectric Engineering, pp. 85-121; Van Erp, J.B., Lotte, F., Tangermann, M., Brain-computer interfaces beyond medical applications (2012) IEEE Computer Society; Wahed, S., Islam, M., Biswas, P.C., An approach for letter recognition system modeling based on prominent features of EEG (2015) 1st International Conference on Electrical & Electronic Engineering (LCEEE); Michahial, S., Kumar, R.R., Speech synthesizer and Feature Extraction Using DWT with classification by Euclidian Distance and neural network of EEG signals (2012) International Journal of Advanced Research in Computer and Communication Engineering, , K P.H., K A.P; (2014) Emotiv, , http://www.emotiv.com/epoc.php; Shenoi, B.A., (2005) Introduction to Digital Signal Processing and Filter Design, , John Wiley and Sons; Podder, P., Khan, T.Z., Khan, M.H., Rahman, M., Comparative performance analysis of hamming, hanning, and blackman window (2014) International Journal on Computer Applications, 96 (18); Cortes, C., Vapnik, V., Support-vector networks (1995) Machine Learning
Correspondence Address: Andi; School of Computer Science, Indonesia; email: andi@binus.edu

Title: Software evolution on edc to support pin-based credit card
Source title: Far East Journal of Electronics and Communications
Affiliations: Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Program in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Andi, Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Program in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Based on a circular letter from Central Bank of Indonesia No. 16/25/DKSP, all credit cards issued by Indonesian banks should use 6 digits online PIN by July 31, 2015. The policy causes software evolution for all EDC machines from acquirer bank. The change is needed to support PIN verification on credit cards that use online PIN CVM (Cardholder Verification Method) and on a credit card that uses signature CVM. Also, PIN verification is used for local credit cards with entry mode swipe/magnetic stripe. This project internship discusses the process of implementation which done on acquirer bank EDC machines to fulfill the requirement mentioned before based on SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle) process. It is expected with the use of online PIN verification, fraud which caused by missing or stolen card can be reduced and minimized. © 2017 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.
Author Keywords: Credit card; CVM; Fraud; PIN; Software evolution
